item.title: Biden pardons US veterans convicted in gay-sex cases by military
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX may come to rescue of Sunita Williams
item.description: Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams, who launched aboard the Starliner on June 5, were initially scheduled to return after nine days.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Graphene in Changâ€™e-5 moon samples: Chinese scientists stir debate on lunar origin theory
item.description: The Chang'e-5 mission's discovery of graphene in lunar soil challenges moon formation theories, reshaping our understanding of lunar geology. This significant finding prompts further research into the moon's composition, history, and the processes that shaped it, highlighting the importance of continued lunar exploration to unravel celestial mysteries.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How much money can CNN earn from the Trump-Biden debate?
item.description: The debate between Trump and Biden is anticipated to attract a massive audience, eager to watch the candidates discuss and argue over key national issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Family dynamics: How Melania-Ivanka relationship changed after Trump conviction
item.description: A source close to the family noted that "Melania and Ivanka are rumored to be getting along better since Donald Trump was convicted in New York." This marks a significant shift in their relationship, which has been the subject of much speculation and public interest over the years, a Newsweek report said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia outlines plan to overthrow US-led world order
item.description: The evolving global landscape challenges traditional power structures, emphasizing cultural diversity, and the rise of China and India. These shifts may lead to increased stability and cooperation in the international arena.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Controversy erupts over Chinese teen besting MIT students in Alibaba math test
item.description: Jiang Ping's victory in the math competition resonated nationwide, sparking positive reactions on social media and challenging educational stereotypes in China.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Icon of the seas: Fire breaks out on world's largest cruise ship
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: American woman visits ashram in Bahamas, goes missing mid-retreat
item.description: As the search for Taylor Casey in the Bahamas intensifies, authorities and family members are deeply concerned about her well-being. With safety warnings issued by the US State Department for Nassau, travelers are urged to remain vigilant. The collaborative efforts between local authorities, the Ashram, and the US Embassy reflect a dedicated approach to resolving this mysterious disappearance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinaâ€™s ax-wielding coast guard tests limits in South China Sea
item.description: The latest clash in the South China Sea saw China's coast guard using axes and knives, resulting in a Philippine sailor losing his thumb. This incident highlighted Beijing's aggressive stance towards Manila and its US allies. The Philippines Armed Forces labeled the June 17 actions, which included throwing rocks and puncturing an inflatable craft, as a "brutal assault," comparing Chinese sailors to pirates. The US State Department condemned China's actions as "reckless" and a threat to regional peace.

item.title: 'Part of parliament burned': What led to violent protests in Kenya?
item.description: Police in Nairobi, Kenya, fired tear gas and water cannons at crowds protesting proposed tax hikes, resulting in five deaths and 31 injuries, as reported by several NGOs, including Amnesty Kenya. The confrontation turned deadly, with five people being shot dead. In a joint statement, several NGOs including Amnesty Kenya reported that five people were shot dead and 31 injured.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: George Latimer, a pro-Israel centrist, defeats Republican Jamaal Bowman in New York Democratic primary
item.description: George Latimer's Democratic primary win exposed party divisions over Israel, shifting towards centrist candidates. The victory disrupted a stable season, emphasizing differing views on key issues like a two-state solution and House resolutions. Additionally, John Avlon secured the Democratic nomination, challenging incumbent Nick LaLota.

item.title: British Airways IT glitch causes havoc at Heathrow, stranding passengers for hours
item.description: Heathrow Airport experienced significant disruption due to a breakdown in British Airways' IT systems, causing passengers to be stuck on planes and face prolonged waits for their luggage. The issue, which started the previous evening, resulted in travelers waiting for extended periods to collect their belongings. Passengers found themselves stranded on aircraft, unable to disembark, while others encountered substantial delays at baggage claim areas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: This is what pilot did after plane's canopy burst open mid-air
item.description: A pilot experienced a harrowing moment during her training when her plane's canopy burst open mid-air, causing significant discomfort, breathing difficulties, and impaired visibility. Narine Melkumjan shared a video of the incident, hoping her experience would serve as a cautionary tale for budding pilots. Narine Melkumjan intended to highlight the importance of being prepared for unexpected situations during flight. The video captures the moment the canopy burst open and shows Melkumjan struggling with the immediate effects.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange pleads guilty in deal with US securing his freedom
item.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange admitted to one felony count related to publishing classified US military information. The plea agreement with the Justice Department ensures his release, ending a prolonged legal battle that ignited debates on press freedom and national security. The US Justice Department agreed to hold the hearing on the remote island due to Assange's opposition to coming to the continental US and its proximity to Australia, where he will return after entering his plea.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's attorneys accused of 'hijacking' classified documents hearing
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
